# Council of Ministers / Majlis Al-Wuzara <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## Council of Ministers Resolution No. 1586 of 2024
### Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Citizenship Certificates from Certain Individuals

The Council of Ministers / Majlis Al-Wuzara <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qa'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024,
- And Article (21 bis "A") of Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
- And based on the submission of the First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior,
Has resolved:
### Article One
The Kuwaiti citizenship certificate shall be withdrawn from those who acquired it derivatively from the holder of that certificate:
1- Juma'an Ghazi Zayid Marzouq Al-Daihani <orig>جمعان غازي زايد مرزوق الديحاني</orig>.

# Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>
## Announcement
Regarding the issuance of the First Instance Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> judgment - dated 24/12/2024 in Case No. (9/2024), Bankruptcy Circuit /3
Filed by: Adel Issa Abdulaziz Al-Abduljalil <orig>عادل عيسى عبدالعزيز العبدالجليل</orig> - on his own behalf and in his capacity as owner of Calier for Decoration Contracting <orig>كالير لمقاولات الديكور</orig>.
Against / 1- Al-Takhsees Al-Handasiya General Building Contracting Company (LLC) <orig>شركة التخصيص الهندسية للمقاولات العامة للمباني (ذ.م.م)</orig>.
2- Mohammed Jassim Abdullah Al-Sanea <orig>محمد جاسم عبدالله صانع</orig> - on his own behalf and in his capacity as the company's manager.
Pursuant to the provisions of Article (172) of Bankruptcy Law No. (71/2020) and its Executive Regulations.

In the Name of His Highness the Amir of Kuwait
Sheikh Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
The First Instance Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>
Bankruptcy Circuit /3
At the session held publicly in the Court on Tuesday, 24/12/2024 AD.
Presided by Professor: Abdullah Ali Al-Harbi <orig>عبدالله علي الحربي</orig>, Court Agent
With the membership of Professor: Mohammed Abdulrahman Al-Nuwaif <orig>محمد عبدالرحمن النويف</orig>, Court Agent
And the membership of Professor: Waleed Khalid Al-Rabie <orig>وليد خالد الربيع</orig>, Court Agent
And in the presence of Mr.: Othman Adel Al-Siddiq <orig>عثمان عادل الصدي</orig>, Session Secretary
(The following judgment was issued)
In Case No.: (9/2024), Bankruptcy Circuit /3
Automated Number: 240819660
Filed by: Adel Issa Abdulaziz Al-Abduljalil <orig>عادل عيسى عبدالعزيز العبدالجليل</orig> - on his own behalf and in his capacity as owner of Calier for Decoration Contracting Company <orig>شركة كالير لمقاولات الديكور</orig>.
Against: 1- Al-Takhsees Al-Handasiya General Building Contracting Company (LLC) <orig>شركة التخصيص الهندسية للمقاولات العامة للمباني (ذ.م.م)</orig>.
2- Mohammed Jassim Abdullah Al-Sanea <orig>محمد جاسم عبدالله الصانع</orig> - on his own behalf and in his capacity as the company's manager.
(Reasons)
After hearing the pleadings, reviewing the documents, and deliberating legally:
*   Whereas the facts of the case were previously encompassed by the decision of the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> issued on 18/2/2024, to which the Court refers to avoid prolixity and repetition; however, the Court summarizes the facts of the case sufficiently to connect the elements of this judgment, in that the decision of the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> dated 22/6/2023 was based on the request of the creditor / Adel Issa Al-Abduljalil <orig>عادل عيسى العبدالجليل</orig> on his own behalf and in his capacity as owner of Calier for Decoration Contracting <orig>كالير لمقاولات الديكور</orig>, and whereas the applicant submitted his request to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> for the commencement of bankruptcy declaration procedures against the respondent, effective from the date of its default on payment, which is the date of the final judgment issued against Al-Takhsees Al-Handasiya General Building Contracting Company (LLC) <orig>شركة التخصيص الهندسية للمقاولات العامة للمباني ذ.م.م</orig>, and the applicant had stated in his request that he had obtained a judgment in Case No. 6125 / 2016 Commercial First Instance / 3 dated 13/1/2019, and its appeal No. 1187 / 2019 Commercial / 13 dated 23/2/2021, obliging the respondent company to pay him the principal debt outstanding against it, based on a contracting agreement concluded between them, amounting to 31,900 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig> and legal interest at 7% from the due date of 15/9/2019 until full payment, totaling 32,645 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig> and 875 fils, however, it ceased payment despite enforcement procedures being taken against it. Whereas the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued his decision dated 28/1/2024 to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures for Al-Takhsees Al-Handasiya General Building Contracting Company (LLC) <orig>شركة التخصيص الهندسية للمقاولات العامة للمباني ذ.م.م</orig>, and set 23/2/2021 as a provisional date for cessation of payment, and ordered the publication and announcement of the decision in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and notification to the concerned parties.
*   Whereas, during the consideration of the case, both the plaintiff and the defendant appeared, each represented by an agent. The representative of the defendant submitted a defense memorandum on 29/10/2024, requesting at its conclusion the dismissal of the case and obliging the plaintiff to pay the expenses and actual legal fees. The representative of the defendant / Al-Takhsees Al-Handasiya Company <orig>شركة التخصيص الهندسية</orig> submitted a folder of documents dated 10/9/2024, the most important of which contained various photocopies of receipts issued by the plaintiff.
*   Whereas the Court decided to reserve the case for judgment to be issued on 26/11/2024, and then decided to extend the pronouncement of the judgment to today's session, in order to complete the review of the documents.
*   Whereas, regarding the subject of the case and the plaintiff's requests therein, it is established by the text of Article 1 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020, which stipulates that, for the purpose of applying the provisions of this law, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning assigned to each of them: ...... Financial insolvency means that the debtor's funds are insufficient to pay his debts.
*   And Article 2 of the same law stipulates that "The provisions of this law apply to: 1- Every natural person proven to have the status of a merchant. 2- Kuwaiti companies ....".
*   And Article 29 thereof stipulated that "The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall decide on the request within ten days from the date of the period specified for responding to it, by issuing his decision to commence preventive settlement, restructuring, or bankruptcy declaration procedures, and shall specify in his decision a provisional date for the cessation of payment. If the decision to commence procedures does not specify the date on which the debtor ceased payment, the date of issuance of the decision to commence procedures shall be considered the provisional date for the cessation of payment."
<page_end>3</page_end>

<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1721, Seventy-First Year
Sunday, 12 Rajab 1446 AH - 12/1/2025 AD
4
</header>

If a decision to commence proceedings is issued after the debtor's death or after their cessation of trade, and the date of cessation of payment is not specified, the date of death or cessation of trade shall be considered a provisional date for the cessation of payment. Article 33 stipulates that the Bankruptcy Department / Idarat Al-Iflas <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten days from the date of the Bankruptcy Judge's / Qadi Al-Iflas <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision to commence, reject, or not accept the proceedings, publish and announce the decision and notify the concerned parties thereof... And Article 34 stipulates that if the Bankruptcy Judge / Qadi Al-Iflas <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decides to accept the commencement of restructuring or bankruptcy proceedings, the same decision shall appoint the trustee nominated by the Bankruptcy Committee / Lajnat Al-Iflas <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> and whose fees have been assessed in accordance with the provisions of this law... And Article 49 stipulates that the trustee shall collect their fees specified in the appointment decision and the necessary expenses incurred from the debtor's known funds for the Bankruptcy Department / Idarat Al-Iflas <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>. An advance payment of such fees and expenses may be disbursed on account by a decision of the Bankruptcy Judge / Qadi Al-Iflas <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>.
And to favor what it deems preferable among them, and to deduce what it considers to be the reality of the case, and its assessment thereof and determining its sufficiency for conviction is its sole prerogative, provided that this assessment is reasonable and does not deviate from what is established in the case documents...".
(Appeals No. 555, 599 / 2005 Commercial, Session 8/10/2006)
*   Given the foregoing and in light of what has been stated, and since the plaintiff's request was for the declaration of the defendant's bankruptcy due to her cessation of payment of the debt owed to her, and it is legally established for the declaration of a debtor's bankruptcy that several conditions must be met: the establishment of their merchant status, their cessation of payment of their debt due to a deficit in their financial position, and that their business is not viable for continuity. Upon the Court's scrutiny of the case documents and the application submitted to the Bankruptcy Department / Idarat Al-Iflas <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> and the procedures taken therein, it finds that these conditions apply to the defendant, as her refusal to pay a debt owed by her, established by an enforceable judicial judgment, due to a deficit in her financial position, has been proven. This resulted in the issuance of a decision to commence her bankruptcy proceedings by the Bankruptcy Judge / Qadi Al-Iflas <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> and the appointment of a trustee over her, in accordance with the previously stated Article 132. Therefore, the Court finds the procedures undertaken by the Bankruptcy Department / Idarat Al-Iflas <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> and its litigation in handling the present application to be valid. Consequently, the plaintiff's request for the declaration of the defendant's bankruptcy is based on a sound factual and legal basis, and the Court rules for the declaration of the defendant's bankruptcy as will be stated in the operative part of the judgment.
*   Article 131 of the same law stipulates that: "...... The Bankruptcy Judge / Qadi Al-Iflas <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall issue his decision to commence bankruptcy proceedings if the following conditions are met: 1- The debtor has ceased payment. 2- There is a deficit in the debtor's financial position. 3- The debtor's business is not viable for continuity."
Article 132 of the same law stipulates that: "In all cases where the Bankruptcy Judge / Qadi Al-Iflas <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issues his decision to commence bankruptcy proceedings, the Bankruptcy Department / Idarat Al-Iflas <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall refer the file of the application for commencement of proceedings to the Bankruptcy Court / Mahkamat Al-Iflas <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> within ten days from the date of the Bankruptcy Judge's / Qadi Al-Iflas <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision to commence bankruptcy proceedings. A report on the procedures taken for the application from its submission until the issuance of the decision to commence proceedings shall be deposited in the file, stating the factual and legal grounds for the decision."
*   Regarding the expenses, including legal fees, the Court obliges the defendant to pay them in accordance with the provisions of Article 119/1 of the Code of Civil Procedure / Qanun Al-Murafa'at <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>, and Article 23 of the Bankruptcy Law / Qanun Al-Iflas <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>.
(For these reasons)
The Court ruled: to declare the bankruptcy of the defendant / Al-Takhsees Al-Handasiya General Building Contracting Company W.L.L. / Sharikat Al-Takhsees Al-Handasiya Lil-Muqawalat Al-Amma Lil-Mabani Dh.M.M. <orig>شركة التخصيص الهندسية للمقاولات العامة للمباني ذ.م.م</orig>, and to set February 23, 2021, as the provisional date for the cessation of payment. The Bankruptcy Department / Idarat Al-Iflas <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall register this judgment in the Commercial Register and publish a summary thereof in the Official Gazette / Al-Jarida Al-Rasmiya <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with the procedures followed in this regard, and adding expenses and an amount of ten Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دنانير كويتي</orig> for legal fees to be borne by the bankrupt entity.
Session Secretary
Court Agent
*   It has been established in the jurisprudence of the Court of Cassation / Mahkamat Al-Tamyeez <orig>محكمة التمييز</orig> that anyone who engages in commercial transactions in their own name and adopts it as a profession is considered a merchant, and that any creditor with a due commercial debt may request the declaration of bankruptcy of their merchant debtor if the merchant's business has become unstable and they have ceased payment of their debt in a manner that indicates a disturbed financial position and a severe financial distress whereby the merchant's credit is shaken, thereby endangering the rights of their creditors. And that deducing whether a person is a merchant or not, and deducing the facts constituting the cessation of payment that lead to the declaration of the merchant's bankruptcy, are among the matters exclusively determined by the trial court / mahkamat al-mawdu' <orig>محكمة الموضوع</orig>, provided it states reasonable grounds for that."
(Appeal No. 159 / 1995 Commercial – Session 30/6/1996)
*   It has been established, and as per the jurisprudence of the Court of Cassation / Mahkamat Al-Tamyeez <orig>محكمة التمييز</orig>, "that the trial court / mahkamat al-mawdu' <orig>محكمة الموضوع</orig> has full authority to examine the evidence and documents submitted to it"
<page_end>4</page_end>

In accordance with the provisions of Article (172) of Bankruptcy Law No. (71/2020) <orig>قانون الإفلاس رقم (2020/71)</orig> and its executive regulations.

In the Name of His Highness the Amir of Kuwait
Sheikh Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
The General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>
Bankruptcy Circuit / 3 <orig>دائرة الإفلاس</orig>
At the session held publicly in the Court on Tuesday, 24/12/2024 AD.
Presided over by Professor: Abdullah Ali Al-Harbi <orig>عبد الله علي الحربي</orig>, Court Agent <orig>وكيل المحكمة</orig>
With the membership of Professor: Mohammed Abdul Rahman Al-Nuwaif <orig>محمد عبد الرحمن النويف</orig>, Court Agent <orig>وكيل المحكمة</orig>
And the membership of Professor: Waleed Khalid Al-Rabie <orig>وليد خالد الربيع</orig>, Court Agent <orig>وكيل المحكمة</orig>
And in the presence of Mr.: Othman Adel Al-Siddiq <orig>عثمان عادل الصدي</orig>, Session Secretary <orig>أمين سر الجلسة</orig>
(The following judgment was issued)
In lawsuit No.: (13/2024) Bankruptcy Circuit / 3 <orig>دائرة الإفلاس</orig>
Automated Number: 241824060
Filed by: Hamad Abdullah Al-Zakariya Al-Hajri <orig>حمد عبد الله الزكريا الهاجري</orig>.
Against:
1- Al-Dunya Al-Alamiyah General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة الدنيا العالمية للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>.
2- Dunya Khazaal General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة دنيا خزعل للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>.
(Reasons)
After hearing the pleadings, reviewing the documents, and deliberating legally:
- Whereas the facts of the lawsuit were previously encompassed by the decision of the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> issued on 6/5/2024, to which the Court refers to avoid prolixity and repetition, however, the Court summarizes the facts of the lawsuit sufficiently to connect the parts of this judgment, in that the decision of the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> dated 6/5/2024 came to address the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> to express an opinion regarding the request submitted by the creditor / Ahmed Abdullah Al-Zakariya Al-Hajri <orig>أحمد عبد الله الزكريا الهاجري</orig>. Whereas the applicant submitted request No. 158 / 2023 dated 10/10/2023, to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> requesting the initiation of bankruptcy declaration procedures <orig>إجراءات شهر إفلاس</orig> against the respondents, and that the amount of the debt that they ceased to pay or are expected to cease paying is 22083 K.D. <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. The applicant provided a copy of the judgment in lawsuit No. 1932/2017 Labor Plenary / 4 <orig>عمالي كلي</orig> issued on 19/9/2019 and its appeal No. 1244, 1269/2019 Labor / 9 issued on 28/4/2021, and a certificate issued by the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> and enforcement seizure officers <orig>محضري حجز تنفيذي</orig>. The applicant obtained the judgment in lawsuit No. 1932 / 2017 Labor Plenary / 4 <orig>عمالي كلي</orig> which obliges the respondents to the request to guarantee and pay him a total amount of 55380 K.D. <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 987 Fils <orig>فلس</orig> and grant him a certificate of experience. The respondents to the request appealed the aforementioned judgment with appeals No. 1244, 1269 / 2019 Labor Al-Ahadi / 2 <orig>عمالي الأحدي</orig>, and it was ruled therein to accept the two appeals and the subsidiary appeal formally, and in substance, to annul the appealed judgment regarding its ruling obliging Al-Wasa'el Al-Mutatawerah General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة الوسائل المتطورة للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> to pay the adjudicated amount and to rule anew to reject the lawsuit, and to amend it to oblige the appellant in appeal No. 1244 / 2019 to pay the first appellee a total amount of 2627 K.D. <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 717 Fils <orig>فلس</orig>, and to uphold it regarding the subsidiary lawsuit, and to oblige the National Construction Company <orig>الشركة الوطنية للإنشاءات</orig> to pay the first appellee a total of his labor dues amounting to 11147 K.D. <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 359 Fils <orig>فلس</orig>, and to uphold it regarding the certificate of experience. And regarding the subject of the subsidiary appeal, to annul the appealed judgment regarding its ruling obliging Kuwaiti Arab Reconstruction Company <orig>شركة الإعمار العربية الكويتية</orig> and Dutch Countryside for Flowers and Plants Company <orig>شركة الريف الهولندي للزهور والنباتات</orig> to pay the adjudicated amount and to rule anew to dismiss the lawsuit for being filed by a means not prescribed by law before it, and to amend it to oblige Dunya Khazaal General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة دنيا خزعل للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> to pay the worker an amount of 12014 K.D. <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 186 Fils <orig>فلس</orig>, and to uphold it regarding obliging it to grant him a certificate of experience. The applicant was unable to enforce the judgment despite taking all enforcement procedures, and initiated enforcement procedures for the judgment under judicial rulings and initiated enforcement procedures against them, as the respondents to the request were refraining from payment. On 9/10/2023, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decided to address the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> regarding the request to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures <orig>إجراءات شهر إفلاس</orig>, and pursuant to this decision, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> convened and rejected this request on 10/10/2023. On 10/10/2023, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decided to consolidate requests No. 159, 158 / 2023 with the request to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures <orig>إجراءات شهر إفلاس</orig> filed against them due to their cessation of payment, and pursuant to this decision, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> submitted its report No. 58 and concluded with the result stated therein. The facts of the second request No. 159 / 2023 dated 1/10/2023 summarize that the applicant submitted a request to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures <orig>إجراءات شهر إفلاس</orig> against them due to their cessation of payment and that the amount of the debt that they ceased to pay or are expected to cease paying is 18670 K.D. <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. The applicant provided copies of judicial judgments in lawsuit No. 939 / 2015 Labor Plenary / 1 <orig>عمالي كلي</orig> and its appeal No. 473 / 2021 Labor / 3. The applicant was unable to enforce the judgment. On 19/2/2024, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decided to consolidate requests No. 159, 158 / 2023 with the request to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures <orig>إجراءات شهر إفلاس</orig> filed against them / Dunya Khazaal General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة دنيا خزعل للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> and Dunya Khazaal General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة دنيا خزعل للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> on 1/10/2023 as a temporary date for cessation of payment and to appoint Dr. Ali Owaid Rakhees <orig>علي عويد رخيص</orig>, registered in the register of licensed auditors at the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>, as a trustee to inventory the assets and properties of the respondents, prepare an updated financial statement and a list of debts, a liquidation and distribution plan, and take all necessary precautionary measures, along with publishing this decision and announcing it in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and notifying the concerned parties.

<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1721, Seventy-First Year
Sunday, 12 Rajab 1446 AH - 12/1/2025 AD
6
</header>
• Whereas, during the consideration of the lawsuit, the plaintiff appeared in person and insisted on his demands, and the two defendant companies did not attend.
• Whereas, the Court decided to reserve the case for a judgment to be issued in today's session.
• Whereas, regarding the subject of the lawsuit and the plaintiff's demands, it is stipulated by Article 1 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020, which states that in applying the provisions of this law, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning assigned to each of them ....... Financial insolvency means that the debtor's funds are insufficient to pay his debts.
• Article 2 of the same law stipulates that "the provisions of this law shall apply to: 1- Every natural person proven to have the status of a merchant 2- Kuwaiti companies ....".
• Article 29 thereof stipulated that "the Bankruptcy Judge shall decide on the application within ten days from the date of the specified periods for responding to it, by issuing his decision to commence preventive settlement procedures, restructuring, or declaring bankruptcy, and shall specify in his decision a provisional date for the cessation of payments. If the decision to commence procedures does not specify the date on which the debtor ceased payments, the date of issuance of the decision to commence procedures after the debtor's death or after ceasing trade shall be considered. If the decision to commence procedures is issued after the debtor's death or after ceasing trade and the date of cessation of payments is not specified, the date of death or the date of ceasing trade shall be considered a provisional date for the cessation of payments. Article 33 stipulates that the Bankruptcy Department shall, within ten days from the date of issuance of the Bankruptcy Judge's decision to commence, reject, or not accept the procedures, publish and announce the decision and notify concerned parties thereof .... Article 34 stipulates that if the Bankruptcy Judge decides to accept the commencement of restructuring or bankruptcy procedures, the same decision shall appoint the trustee nominated by the Bankruptcy Committee and whose fees have been assessed in accordance with the provisions of this law .... Article 49 stipulates that the trustee shall collect his fees specified by decision and the necessary expenses incurred from the debtor's known funds for the Bankruptcy Department, and a payment of such fees and expenses may be disbursed on account by a decision of the Bankruptcy Judge."
• Article 131 of the same law stipulates that "....... the Bankruptcy Judge shall issue his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures if the following conditions are met: 1- The debtor has ceased payments 2- There is a deficit in the debtor's financial position 3- The debtor's business is not viable for continuity."
• Article 132 of the same law stipulates that "in all cases where the Bankruptcy Judge issues his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures, the Bankruptcy Department shall refer the file of the application to commence procedures to the Bankruptcy Court within ten days from the date of issuance of the Bankruptcy Judge's decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures. A report on the procedures taken for the application from its submission until the issuance of the decision to commence procedures shall be deposited in the file, along with a statement of the factual and legal grounds for the decision."
• It was established in the jurisprudence of the Court of Cassation that anyone who engages in commercial transactions in his own name and adopts them as his profession is a merchant, and that every creditor with a due commercial debt has the right to request the declaration of bankruptcy of his merchant debtor if the merchant's business is disrupted and he ceases to pay his debt in a manner indicating a disturbed financial position and a persistent deficiency that shakes the merchant's creditworthiness, thereby endangering the rights of his creditors. The determination of whether a person is a merchant or not, and the extraction of facts constituting the cessation of payments leading to the declaration of a merchant's bankruptcy, are matters within the sole discretion of the trial court, provided it states reasonable grounds for its determination.
(Appeal No. 159 / 1995 Commercial - Session 30/6/1996)
• It was established, in accordance with the jurisprudence of the Court of Cassation, that "the trial court has full authority to examine the evidence and documents submitted to it, to prefer what it deems preferable, and to deduce what it considers to be the reality of the case. Its assessment of the sufficiency of such evidence for conviction is solely within its purview, provided that this assessment is reasonable and does not deviate from what is established in the case files...".
(Appeals Nos. 555 / 599 / 2005 Commercial - Session 8/10/2006)
• In light of the foregoing, and given that the plaintiff's request was for the declaration of bankruptcy of the two defendants due to their cessation of payment of the debt owed to him, and it is legally established for the declaration of a debtor's bankruptcy that several conditions must be met: proof of his status as a merchant, his cessation of payment of his debt due to a deficit in his financial position, and that his business is not viable for continuity. Upon the Court's examination of the case files and the application submitted to the Bankruptcy Department, and the procedures undertaken, it finds that these conditions apply to the two defendants, as their refusal to pay a debt owed by them, established by an enforceable eight-fold judgment, due to their financial insolvency, has been proven. This resulted in the issuance of a decision to commence their bankruptcy declaration procedures by the Bankruptcy Judge and the appointment of a trustee over them, in accordance with the aforementioned Article 132. Therefore, the Court deems the procedures undertaken by the Bankruptcy Department and its judge in handling the present application to be valid. Consequently, the plaintiff's request for the declaration of bankruptcy of the two defendants is based on sound factual and legal grounds, and the Court rules for the declaration of bankruptcy of the two defendants as will be stated in the operative part.
• Whereas, regarding the expenses, the Court obliges the two defendants to bear them in accordance with the provisions of Article 1/119 of the Code of Civil Procedure and Article 23 of the Bankruptcy Law.

(For these reasons)

### The Court Ruled:
- To declare the bankruptcy of the two defendants / Al-Dunya Al-Alamiyah General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة الدنيا العالمية للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>, and Dunya Khazaal General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة دنيا خزعل للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>, and to set October 1, 2023, as a provisional date for the cessation of payments. The Bankruptcy Department shall register this judgment in the Commercial Register and publish its summary in the Official Gazette in accordance with the procedures followed in this regard, and add the expenses and an amount of ten Dinars for legal fees to be borne by the bankruptcy estate.
In accordance with Article (8) of the Bankruptcy Law, decisions issued by the Bankruptcy Judge shall be executive instruments according to this law, and the Registry Department shall affix the executive formula to them, and they shall be enforceable immediately upon their issuance and without notification.
Secretary
Bankruptcy Judge

- Ministerial Decision No. (2018/2) issued on 31/1/2018, delegating the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose warning and closure penalties on violating industrial projects.
- Violation report submitted by the Industrial Safety Department <orig>قسم السلامة الصناعية</orig> No. (B4-14), issued on 18/8/2024, stating that / Hydromist Factory Management Company <orig>شركة هيدرومست لإدارة المصانع</orig> committed the following violation:

# Decision No. GIA (138) of 2024
## Regarding the Imposition of an Administrative Penalty

The Acting Director General
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law <orig>قانون الصناعة</orig> and its executive regulations and their amendments.
- Ministerial Decision No. (2/2018) issued on 31/1/2018, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma Lil-Sina'a <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose warning and closure penalties on violating industrial projects.
- The violation report submitted by the Industrial Safety Department <orig>قسم السلامة الصناعية</orig> No. (B4-17), dated 20/8/2024, which includes the commission of the following violation by Al-Rattam General Trading and Contracting Company / Sharikat Al-Rattam Lil-Tijara Al-Amma Wal-Muqawalat <orig>شركة الرطام للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> factory/company:
  - Absence of a fire license.
- The report of the Industrial Safety Department <orig>قسم السلامة الصناعية</orig> dated 21/11/2024, stating that the violation is still ongoing.
- The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations <orig>اللجنة الدائمة للمخالفات الصناعية</orig> in its meeting No. (492/2024/11) held on 2/12/2024.
- And based on what was presented by Mr./ Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
- And in furtherance of the public interest,

Has decided

(Article One)
To warn Mr./ Al-Rattam General Trading and Contracting Company / Sharikat Al-Rattam Lil-Tijara Al-Amma Wal-Muqawalat <orig>شركة الرطام للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>
located in Al-Sulaibiya Crafts Expansion Area <orig>توسعة حرفية الصليبية</orig> - Plot (1) Parcel (E22) -
of the necessity to remove the aforementioned violation within a maximum period of (three months).
Should the violation not be removed, stricter measures will be taken in accordance with
the rules applicable in this regard.

(Article Two)
This decision shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and
the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

# Decision No. GIA (137) of 2024

Has decided

located in Al-Sulaibiya Crafts Expansion Area <orig>توسعة حرفية الصليبية</orig> - Plot (1) Parcel (E20) -
of the necessity to remove the aforementioned violation within a maximum period of (three months).

(Article Two)
This decision shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and
the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

# Resolution No. H.A.S. (140) of 2024
## Regarding the Closure of a Plot

The Acting Director General
Having reviewed:
*   Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industrial Law <orig>قانون الصناعة</orig>, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
*   Ministerial Resolution No. (2/2018) issued on 31/1/2018, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose warning and closure penalties on violating industrial projects.
*   The violation report submitted by the Industrial Inspection Department <orig>قسم التفتيش الصناعي</orig> No. (A3-81), issued on 6/8/2024, stating that / Future House Company <orig>شركة فيوتشر هاوس</orig> (Abdul Rahman Mohammed Al-Abdullah Al-Bassam <orig>عبد الرحمن محمد العبد الله البسام</orig>) committed the following violation:
    *   Violation of activity: presence of a furnace and mold casting.
    *   The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations <orig>اللجنة الدائمة للمخالفات الصناعية</orig> in its meeting No. (492/2024/11) held on 2/12/2024.
*   And based on what was presented by Mr. / Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
And in furtherance of the public interest.

### Has Decided
(Article One)
To close shop No. (28) located in Al-Rai <orig>الري</orig> area – Plot (1) – Plot No. (1507) belonging to M/s. / Future House Company <orig>شركة فيوتشر هاوس</orig> – until the violations and their consequences are removed.

(Article Two)
In the event of failure to remove the violation after (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.

(Article Three)
This resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall be effective from the date of its issuance. The concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

# Decision No. G.A.I. (143) of 2024
## Regarding the Closure of a Plot

The Acting Director General
Having reviewed:
*   Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law and its Executive Regulations and their amendments.
*   Ministerial Decision No. (2018/2) issued on 31/1/2018, delegating the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma Lil-Sina'a <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose the penalties of warning and closure on violating industrial projects.
*   The violation report submitted by the Industrial Safety Department <orig>قسم السلامة الصناعية</orig> No. (B4-11), issued on 7/8/2024, stating that / Rasi Company for Preparing Ready Meals <orig>شركة رسي لتحضير الوجبات الغذائية الجاهزة</orig> - committed the following violations:
    *   Improper storage / storage of hazardous materials (storage of gas cylinders inside the plot).
    *   Absence of a fire license.
*   The report of the Industrial Safety Department <orig>قسم السلامة الصناعية</orig> dated 21/11/2024, stating that the violation is still ongoing.
*   The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations <orig>اللجنة الدائمة للمخالفات الصناعية</orig> in its meeting No. (492/2024/11) held on 2/12/2024.
*   And based on what was presented by Mr. / Deputy Director General for Industrial Standards and Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
*   And in furtherance of the public interest.

Has decided:
(Article One)
Closure of / Plot No. (E36) located in the Sulaibiya Crafts Expansion Area <orig>منطقة توسعة حرفية الصليبية</orig> - Block (1), belonging to / Rasi Company for Preparing Ready Meals <orig>شركة رسي لتحضير الوجبات الغذائية الجاهزة</orig> - until the violations and their consequences are removed.

(Article Two)
In the event that the violation is not removed after (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.

(Article Three)
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force from the date of its issuance. The concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

# Decision No. G.A.I. (141) of 2024

# Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Resolution No. (01) of 2025
</header>
Regarding the collective investment scheme license granted to Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> for establishing Al-Lulu Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق اللؤلؤة للسوق النقدي</orig> in Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>الدينار الكويتي</orig> in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia.

The entities that receive subscription applications are:
- Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>
- Gulf Bank <orig>بنك الخليج</orig>

Article Three
The Fund's objectives are based on what is stated in the prospectus.

Article Four
The Fund's term is fifteen years, commencing from the date of its registration in the Funds Register <orig>سجل الصناديق</orig> with the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>, and is renewable for similar periods upon the request of the Fund Manager <orig>مدير الصندوق</orig> and after obtaining the approval of the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> and unit holders representing more than 50% of the Fund's issued capital.

Article Five
The Fund shall be granted a temporary license for a period of three months from the start date of the subscription, with the aim of completing the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> requirements and the minimum capital of the Fund. No activity of the Fund may be exercised based on this temporary license.

Article Six
The applicant may close the subscription period and suffice with the subscribed capital at any time during the temporary license, provided that the target group invited to subscribe is announced or notified at least three working days prior to the new closing date.

Article Seven
In the event that the temporary license period expires without completing the requirements stipulated in Article Five of this Resolution, the temporary license shall lapse, unless the validity of the license is extended for another similar period, upon the request of the license applicant and before the expiry of the original period of the temporary license.

Article Eight
The prescribed fees shall be paid within thirty days from the date of issuance of this Resolution. In case of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the Resolution shall be deemed null and void.

Article Nine
The Fund shall be licensed for a period of three years from the date of its registration in the Funds Register <orig>سجل الصناديق</orig> with the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>, after completing the minimum capital.

Article Ten
The competent authorities shall implement this Resolution, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- And the request of Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> to establish Al-Lulu Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق اللؤلؤة للسوق النقدي</orig> in Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>الدينار الكويتي</orig> in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>;
- And the Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association of Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>;
- And the Articles of Association, prospectus, and service provider agreements for Al-Lulu Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق اللؤلؤة للسوق النقدي</orig> in Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>الدينار الكويتي</orig> in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia;
- And based on Resolution No. (24) of 2023 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector <orig>قطاع الإشراف</orig> issued on 12/02/2023.

Has resolved the following:
Article One
Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> is granted approval to establish Al-Lulu Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق اللؤلؤة للسوق النقدي</orig> in Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>الدينار الكويتي</orig> in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia. It shall be offered for public subscription with variable capital, with limits ranging between a minimum of KWD 2,000,000 (Two Million Kuwaiti Dinars only) and a maximum of KWD 500,000,000 (Five Hundred Million Kuwaiti Dinars only), with a nominal value of KWD 1 (One Kuwaiti Dinar only) per unit. None of the unit holders/subscribers/participants may subscribe to the Fund for the first time with less than KWD 1,000 (One Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only) and in multiples of KWD 1 (One Kuwaiti Dinar only).

Article Two
500,000,000 units (Five Hundred Million Units only) shall be offered for subscription, equivalent to KWD 500,000,000 (Five Hundred Million Kuwaiti Dinars only). The participation of the Fund Manager <orig>مدير الصندوق</orig> in the Fund's units at establishment must not be less than KWD 100,000 (One Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only) or its equivalent in other currencies as a minimum. The Fund Manager <orig>مدير الصندوق</orig> may dispose of or redeem some of the units owned by him if their net value exceeds the minimum stipulated in this Article.

Head of Supervision Sector <orig>قطاع الإشراف</orig>
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>
Issued on: January 9, 2025 AD

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- The Articles of Association and Memorandum of Incorporation of Kuwait Financial Centre K.P.S.C. (Markaz) <orig>شركة المركز المالي الكويتي</orig> and the agreement concluded between the representative of the collective investment scheme, Markaz Investment Advisors Ltd, and the marketing manager, Kuwait Financial Centre K.P.S.C. (Markaz) <orig>شركة المركز المالي الكويتي</orig>;
- The request from Kuwait Financial Centre K.P.S.C. (Markaz) <orig>شركة المركز المالي الكويتي</orig> to undertake the private marketing of shares of MKZ Development 44 Company <orig>شركة إم كي زي ديفيلوبمنت 44</orig>;
- And based on Resolution No. (24) of 2023 regarding the amendment of final approval authorities for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 2023/02/12.

Decided the following:
## Article One
Kuwait Financial Centre K.P.S.C. (Markaz) <orig>شركة المركز المالي الكويتي</orig> is licensed to privately market 30,000 shares (thirty thousand shares only) of MKZ Development 44 Company <orig>شركة إم كي زي ديفيلوبمنت 44</orig> within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, which originated in the Cayman Islands, and the price per share shall be 1,000 US Dollars (one thousand US Dollars only) per share.

## Article Two
The shares to be marketed within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> shall be offered to professional clients only, as stipulated in Book One (Definitions) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, and their amendments. The entity receiving subscription requests shall be:
- Kuwait Financial Centre K.P.S.C. (Markaz) <orig>شركة المركز المالي الكويتي</orig>.

## Article Three
The objectives of the collective investment scheme shall be determined based on what is stated in the prospectus.

## Article Four
The marketing license duration is one year, renewable annually, starting from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.

## Article Five
The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this decision. In case of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the decision shall be considered null and void.

## Article Six
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Head of Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب الفليج</orig>

Issued on: 9 January 2025 AD

Bids shall be placed in the designated box at the Authority's headquarters and shall be valid for a period of (90) days from the date of opening the bid envelopes. The bid must be accompanied by a preliminary guarantee of 2% of the bid value, which should be in the form of an accredited letter of guarantee or a certified check issued by one of the accredited local banks, and valid for the duration of the bid. Please note that this practice is indivisible, and alternative offers will not be accepted.
The last deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Wednesday, 29/1/2025 AD

- Bids shall be submitted to the General Services Department located at the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> headquarters in Al-Riqqa <orig>الرقعي</orig>, Block 2, Street 106. No bid received after this deadline will be considered. A purchase authorization letter, a copy of the civil ID, and company documents must be presented.
- The aforementioned cash payment shall be made via K-Net card.
- The final time for submitting bids is 2:00 PM on the day specified above. An authorization for bid submission and a copy of the civil ID must be presented.
- A national labor percentage certificate, valid for one year from the date of bid submission, must be provided.
- Applicants for the practice must review the practice documents and submit all questions and inquiries related to the practice in writing during the preliminary meeting. No inquiries will be accepted thereafter. In the event of failure by any applicant to attend the practice, they shall be obligated to implement all clauses agreed upon during the preliminary meeting without having the right to claim any material demands or additional time periods from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
- Attendance at the preliminary meeting requires bringing the following:
  1. Original purchase receipt.
  2. Authorization to attend and a copy of the authorized person's civil ID.
- Bid envelopes will be opened on Sunday, 19/1/2025, at 2:00 PM, at the location specified in the practice documents, in a public session attended by bidders or their representatives.
- The practice is indivisible, does not accept alternative offers, and follows a single-envelope system (technical and financial).
- Bids shall be valid for 90 days from the closing date. The preliminary guarantee is (525) K.D. and must be valid throughout the bid's validity period in the name of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
- This announcement is considered an integral part of the practice documents.
- For more information, please visit the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> website on the World Wide Web.

# Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>
## Correction
An error occurred in the announcement of Practice No. PAM <orig>ق ع</orig> (10-2024/2025) regarding the inspection device management program for the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>. The preliminary meeting date was stated as Sunday, 9-1-2025, while the correct date is Thursday, 9-1-2025. Therefore, the Authority notifies practitioners of the correct statement mentioned, and the announcement will be made after correction.

## Announcement and Invitation to Practice
### No. PAM <orig>ق ع</orig> (10-2024/2025) regarding the Inspection Device Management Program for the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>
The Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> announces a practice for the execution of the aforementioned works and invites all those who meet the conditions stipulated in Public Tenders Law No. (49) of 2016 and its executive regulations, and Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> Circular No. (5) of 2020 regarding public procurement systems, provided that the practitioner is a company or establishment classified by the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig> in the same field.
Practice documents can be obtained from the General Services Department – Tenders Preparation and Follow-up Section, 10th Floor, at the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> headquarters in Al-Riqqa <orig>الرقعي</orig>, Block 2, Street 106.

# Announcement

The Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> announces the offering of Tender No. 2134157-RFP: NEW NK EW INJECTION NETWORK FOR RE AREA (New Network for Excess Water Injection in North Kuwait, Al-Rawdatain <orig>الروضتين</orig> Area).

## Tender 1: Upon Request from Kuwait Oil Company

Upon request from Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig>
Tender documents can be obtained from the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.

<table_caption>Tender Details for Kuwait Oil Company Request (Tender 1)</table_caption>
<table>
| Tender | Scheduled Date for Bid Submission (Closing Date) | Price | Guarantee |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 2025-01-12     | 2025-04-13 | 10000         | 1,000,000 KD valid for 90 days in favor of the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> |
</table>

### Preliminary Meeting (Inquiry Session) for Tender 1

Preliminary Meeting
(Inquiry Session)
11:00 AM on Sunday, 16/02/2025, at the MART Conference Hall, Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig> building. Companies that have purchased the documents must send an email to MAABAHILI@KOCKW.COM, with a copy to FAQALLAF@KOCKW.COM, and HAKARAM@KOCKW.COM three days prior to the meeting date.

## General Instructions for Tender Submission

Tender documents will be published on the Agency's website for review before proceeding to purchase the documents.
-   The final time for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on the day specified in the above announcement for bid submission.
-   Bidders and practitioners must adhere to the instructions regarding the submission and deposit of bids on the CD available on the Agency's website WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW.
-   The aforementioned cash equivalent must be paid by certified check or K-Net card.
-   Companies / bidders wishing to submit inquiries or clarifications must adhere to submitting them to the relevant entity at the time and place specified in the table above for the preliminary meeting (inquiry session). No inquiries or clarifications submitted to the Agency will be considered.
-   All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, except for the bid form and the initial security, which must be submitted as hard copies.
-   Indivisible
-   A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid.
-   The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, stating that there is no suspension on the bidder's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector. Bids that do not include this certificate will be disqualified.
-   This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as interested companies have the right to attend the bid opening session.

## Tender 2: Upon Request from Kuwait Oil Company

Upon request from Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig>
Tender documents can be obtained from the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.

</table>

### Preliminary Meeting (Inquiry Session) for Tender 2

(Inquiry Session)

- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) are exempted from the fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with the text of Article (39) of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. 49/2016.
- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) wishing to apply for the tender must attach with their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for the Care and Development of Small and Medium Enterprises <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, including its accreditation as a small or medium project.

# Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>
## Announcement
The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> announces the launch of Tender No.: 2024/69 and 2025- for the exploitation and operation of shop No. (3) in the Cultural Heritage Village <orig>قرية الموروث الثقافي</orig> at the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> (shawarma restaurant), in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the tender documents, which can be purchased via the Ministry of Information's <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> website using the barcode attached to the announcement, starting from Sunday, 12/1/2025, for a non-refundable fee of (20 K.D.) only twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. Offers shall be submitted to the Purchasing Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> – Ground Floor – Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> – Al-Sour Street <orig>شارع السور</orig> inside sealed envelopes and must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than 2% and no more than 5% of the bid value, in the form of a certified check or an unconditional, unreserved, and irrevocable letter of guarantee issued by one of the local banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in favor of the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>, valid for the bid validity period of (90 days). The envelope must be sealed and bear the tender number on the outside as indicated above, while avoiding mentioning the bidder's name or any indication thereof. The final deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 6/2/2025.
The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> will hold a preliminary meeting on Monday, 20/1/2025, at 11:00 AM at the Cultural Heritage Village <orig>قرية الموروث الثقافي</orig> affiliated with the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> (Sea Day <orig>يوم البحار</orig>), to respond to inquiries submitted regarding the tender. Anyone who has purchased the tender documents may attend the meeting in person or be represented. Everything recorded in the meeting minutes shall be considered an integral part of the tender documents and shall be binding on the bidders. The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their approved responses to all bidders before the tender closing date.
- The aforementioned cash payment shall be made via K-Net card.
- Companies wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must submit them to the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> at the specified time and place for the preliminary meeting.
- The bid must be submitted in a single sealed envelope containing all documents, filled, signed, and stamped by the bidder.
- All documents shall be submitted on 3 non-copyable CDs, with the exception of (the bid form, initial security deposit, national labor percentage certificate, and a copy of the purchase receipt, which shall be submitted as hard copies).
- The tender is indivisible, and alternative offers will not be accepted.
- This announcement is considered an integral part of the tender documents.
- To obtain a copy, the practitioner must register and pay the fees through the website
https://eservice.media.gov.kw/purchase/

## A Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company
### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

The General Assembly of shareholders of Asnan Tower Medical Services Company <orig>شركة أسنان تاور للخدمات الطبية</orig> – a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company – held its Extraordinary Meeting at 1:00 PM on Wednesday, December 25, 2024. The meeting was held online via the (ZOOM) program, one of the electronic communication platforms.

The meeting session was chaired by Dr. Issa Nabil Bader Al-Essa <orig>عيسى نبيل بدر العيسى</orig> in his capacity as Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer.
The meeting was also attended by:
- Mr. Omar Al-Zawawi <orig>عمر الزواوي</orig> – representing Gulf Custody Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>.
- Mr. Naveed Khan Mohammed Nazir <orig>نفيد خان محمد نظير</orig> – Board Secretary.
- Shareholders holding 100,000,000 shares, in person and by proxy (representing 100% of the total issued share capital of the company, which amounts to 100,000,000 shares).
The meeting discussed the following agenda: After the announcement of the availability of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, the Chairman of the session opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees, and then proceeded to present the items on the agenda. After reviewing the agenda, the following decisions were taken:
*   The amendment of the text of Article No. (5) of the Articles of Association and Article No. (4) of the Company's Memorandum of Association was approved and ratified, by regularizing the situation and adding new activities to the company's current activities, to become as follows:

Text of the Article before amendment:

1- Establishing, managing, and owning hospitals.

# Al-Asima Real Estate Company <orig>شركة العاصمة العقارية</orig>

## Minutes of the Tenth Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
### Held on 29 / 12 / 2024

The Ordinary General Assembly of Al-Asima Real Estate Company <orig>شركة العاصمة العقارية</orig>, a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed), held its Tenth Extraordinary Meeting at 11:00 AM on Sunday, 29/12/2024, at the premises of Al-Salhiya Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الصالحية العقارية</orig> - Main Entrance - Mezzanine 2 - Main Meeting Room.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Mohammed Khalil Al-Musaibih <orig>محمد خليل المصيبيح</orig>, Board Member, by authorization from Mr. Anwar Abdulaziz Al-Osaimi <orig>أنور عبدالعزيز العصيمي</orig> - Chairman of the Board of Directors. The following also attended the meeting:
- Shareholders holding 1,099,000,000 shares, in person and by proxy, representing 99.90% of the company's total capital shares of 1,100,000,000 shares.
- Mr. Mohammed Bandar Al-Hawwas <orig>محمد بندر الحواس</orig> from Gulf Custody Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>.
After the announcement of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, Mr. Mohammed Khalil Al-Musaibih <orig>محمد خليل المصيبيح</orig>, Board Member, opened the meeting session, welcoming the attendees, and then proceeded to present the items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly for discussion. The following was resolved:
1- Approval of increasing the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 110,000,000 to KWD 125,000,000, an increase of KWD 15,000,000, through a cash debt from the parent company (Al-Salhiya Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الصالحية العقارية</orig> K.S.C.P.) and authorizing the Board of Directors to set the necessary controls and conditions.
2- Amendment of the text of Article No. (5) of the Articles of Association and (6) of the Memorandum of Incorporation as follows:
Text before amendment: "The company's capital is set at KWD 1,100,000,000, distributed over 1,100,000,000 shares, with a value of one hundred fils per share, and all shares are cash shares."

Text after amendment: - "The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital is set at KWD 1,250,000,000, distributed over 125,000,000 shares, with a value of one hundred fils per share, and all shares are cash shares."
This is subject to the approval of the competent authorities.
At the conclusion of the meeting, Mr. Mohammed Khalil Al-Musaibih <orig>محمد خليل المصيبيح</orig>, Board Member, thanked the attendees, and the proceedings of the Tenth Extraordinary General Assembly were concluded at 11:30 AM on the same day.
Chairman of the Board of Directors

# Tyba Kuwaiti Holding Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة طيبة الكويتية القابضة (ش.م.ك.م)</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting <orig>محضر اجتماع الجمعية العمومية غير العادية</orig>
### Held on Monday, December 30, 2024

The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية غير العادية</orig> of the shareholders of Tyba Kuwaiti Holding Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة طيبة الكويتية القابضة (ش.م.ك.م)</orig> – Under Liquidation <orig>تحت التصفية</orig> held its meeting at 11:00 AM on Monday, December 30, 2024, at the office of Grant Thornton – Al-Qatami and Al-Aiban & Partners <orig>جراند ثورونتون – القطامي والعيبان وشركاهم</orig> – Qibla <orig>القبلة</orig> – Grand Souk Building, Tower A – 9th Floor <orig>عمارة السوق الكبير ، برج أ – الدور التاسع</orig>, with the attendance of shareholders representing 137,528,573 shares, which constitutes (76.4%) of the total shareholders, and with the attendance of Mr. Mohammed Hisham Al-Tahl <orig>محمد هشام الطحل</orig> from Grant Thornton – Al-Qatami and Al-Aiban & Partners <orig>جراند ثورونتون – القطامي والعيبان وشركاهم</orig>, the company's auditor.
After the announcement of the legal quorum for the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية غير العادية</orig>, Mr. Nabil Mohammed Ali Abdulrasool <orig>نبيل محمد علي عبدالرسول</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> (Company Liquidator <orig>مصفي الشركة</orig>), opened the meeting, where the agenda items were discussed and unanimously approved by those present:
- Appointment of Mr. Omar Khalid Ali Al-Qahtani <orig>عمر خالد علي القحطاني</orig> as liquidator for Tyba Kuwaiti Holding Company <orig>شركة طيبة الكويتية القابضة</orig>.
- The liquidation period shall be one year.
The meeting concluded at 11:30 AM.
Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>

## Announcement of Practice No. (MOE / 2024/60-2025) for the Supply, Transportation, and Installation of an Enamel Kiln Device for the Needs of the General Technical Guidance for Art Education

The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the offering of a (public) practice for the supply, transportation, and installation of an enamel kiln device in accordance with the technical terms and specifications in the practice documents.

General Guidelines for the Practice:
1- The practice is (public) for practitioners approved by the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- It is stipulated that whoever applies for this practice must be one of the specialized establishments / companies within Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> in the works subject to the practice, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to that effect with their bid, provided that its date is contemporary with the date of the practice's offering.
3- This practice is (indivisible) and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers.
4- The financial consideration for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only.
5- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2000 K.D.) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, and this security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Any bids not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the mentioned controls, will not be considered. The security must be valid for the required bid validity period.
6- The total duration of the contract is two years from the date of signing the contract, during which the contractor is obligated to implement the practice works in accordance with the general and special conditions.
7- The bidder accepts that their bid remains valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be approved after the bid submission.
8- If the practitioner, upon studying the practice, finds any error, deficiency, or ambiguity in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that affects their bid categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will undertake to study these observations and inquiries, answer them, and remove any error, deficiency, or conflict (if any), and no additional responsibility or obligation shall arise for the Ministry as a result.
9- The practice documents shall be deposited in the bids box at the Supplies and Stores Department in South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (10) ten days from the date of publication of the announcement, at exactly (12:00) noon, according to the decision issued by the Ministry regarding changing or extending the closing date. No bid received after the prescribed closing date will be accepted, nor will any amendment to the prices of submitted bids received after the bid submission be considered.
10- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for the execution of the works subject to the practice – if any – within the same bids submitted. The Ministry has the right not to accept the bid unless it includes the filling of the tables in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to what is stated in the technical specifications and conditions of the practice.
11- The practitioner must submit all banking guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.
12- Submission of samples is required.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>

# Ministry of Higher Education / Wizarat Al-Ta'leem Al-'Ali <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig>

No. 2024/43, held on 19/11/2024
After reviewing the requests submitted for amending data in birth and death records, the Committee decided not to object to publication in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the Committee does not receive any objection within fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement, the amendment will be made in the records, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment: The Births and Deaths Committee, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/69 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, met.

Ms. Alia Al-Saffar <orig>علياء الصفار</orig> performed the duties of the Committee Secretary.
The Committee reviewed requests from No. ((773)) to No. ((810)) in the attached list concerning the amendment of data in birth and death records for fallen birth and death registrations. After reviewing and ensuring the completeness of documents and records, the Committee decided to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues. If, after the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement, no objection is submitted, the amendments will be made in the registers, and birth and death certificates will be issued accordingly.

Property Description: (According to the attached description certificate)
1- Property document number 1995/15438, located in Al-Farwaniya <orig>الفروانية</orig> area – Plot No. 47 – Block 66 – from plan No. M/26473, with an area of 2750m², to be sold by public auction with a basic price of (650,000 K.D.) six hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
** According to the description certificate:
The property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor, annexes, and a roof, with a bridge in the house wall and above the garage.
** According to the expert's report:
The disputed property is located in Al-Farwaniya <orig>الفروانية</orig> area, Block (66), Street (81), Plot (47), and is under inspection as follows:
- The property subject of the lawsuit is located at the aforementioned address and matches the specifications of document number (1995/15438) with an area of 2750m².
- During the inspection, the second defendant, Thani Saeed Awad Al-Khureinij Al-Rashidi <orig>ثاني سعيد عوض الخرينج الرشيدي</orig>, was present with civil ID number (26808240055) and granted access to the property for the expert.
- The property is a government house on an internal main street, bordered by neighbors on three sides. Its condition is old, the air conditioning system consists of units, and the property comprises a ground floor and a first floor, with stone cladding.
- The ground floor consists of (7) rooms, (4) bathrooms, and one kitchen, with an internal courtyard and an abandoned shop. The first floor consists of 4 rooms and two bathrooms.
Secondly: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall start at the basic price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees immediately upon the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid not accompanied by the deposit of its full value will be considered in this session. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the expropriated owner resides in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."
President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

Property document number 1999/11817 located in Jaber Al-Ali <orig>جابر العلي</orig>, Plot No. 2 - Parcel 203 - from plan number M / 36965 – with an area of 392 m².

### Note:
There is a violation of a room in the yard <orig>الخوش</orig> made of light materials (Kirby <orig>كيربي</orig>) with an area of 4m².

### *Inspection:
On 16/9/2019, we moved to the property subject of the lawsuit, located in Jaber Al-Ali <orig>جابر العلي</orig> area, Plot 2, Street 25, House 16, in the presence and guidance of the plaintiff Mai Nawaf Al-Humaidi Al-Otaibi <orig>مي نواف الحميدي العتيبي</orig> and in the presence of Mr. Knowledge Expert Khalid Al-Jarbooi <orig>خالد الجربوعي</orig>. The inspection was carried out as follows:
- The property subject of the dispute conforms to what is stated in the sale contract issued by the Government of Kuwait <orig>حكومة الكويت</orig> No. 11817, dated 24/8/1999, with an area of 392 m².
- The property subject of the dispute is a residential house overlooking two streets (front and back) and bordered by a neighbor on the right and on the left.
- The exterior cladding of the property is mosaic, and there are (3) Toyota cars in the private parking spaces of the house.
The door was knocked multiple times, but it was not opened, and an iron lock was found on the door, and the doorbell was not working and was disconnected.
- The plaintiff stated that the property consists of a ground floor containing a hall, two rooms, (2) bathrooms, a kitchen, and a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig>, and the first floor consists of 3 rooms + 3 bathrooms + a hall + a master bedroom + a preparatory kitchen, and a rooftop containing 2 rooms for domestic workers and laundry.
- The air conditioning is central air conditioning.

## Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction starts with a basic price of 260,000 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> "Two Hundred and Sixty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>". Participation in the auction requires at least that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who accepts to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by depositing the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward for the auction with the ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by a full deposit of its value will be considered. The defaulting bidder will be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the expenses of the enforcement procedures amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are requested to proceed at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

### Alert / Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership was dispossessed was residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

### Important Note:
All companies and individual establishments are prohibited from participating in the auction for parcels or houses designated for residential purposes, in accordance with the provisions of Article 230 of the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig> added by Law No. 9 of 2008.

President of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who accepts to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by the deposit of its full value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder <orig>المزايد المتخلف</orig> shall be liable for any decrease in the property's price.
