*   Secondly: Auction Conditions:
    *   First: The auction shall commence at the basic price specified for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by means of a certified check from the drawee bank or a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
    *   Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
    *   Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price. Otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
    *   Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price, in which case the bidding will be reopened in the same session.

## Property Description: (According to the attached Certificate of Description <orig>شهادة الأوصاف</orig>)

1- Property document number 2023/6342 <orig>عقار الوريقة رقم 2023/6342</orig> located in Al-Khalidiya <orig>الخالدية</orig> area - Plot No. 225 - Block No. 1 - Plan M / 27398, with an area of 750 m², by public auction <orig>المزاد العلني</orig> at a base price of KWD 1,080,000 (One Million Eighty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** According to the attached Certificate of Description <orig>شهادة الأوصاف</orig> and Municipal Letter <orig>الكتاب البلدية</orig>:
- The property is a private residence consisting of a basement, ground floor, first floor, and roof, according to the attached plans. The plot was previously registered under plan M / 33906 and is currently as mentioned above.
** According to the Expert's Report <orig>تقرير الخبير</orig>:
The property subject to the dispute <orig>موضوع النزاع</orig> is located in Al-Khalidiya <orig>الخالدية</orig> area - Block 1 - Street 10 - House 4 - Automated Number 10647297 - and was inspected as follows:
1- The subject of the dispute <orig>عين النزاع</orig> is a house overlooking one street, bordered by a neighbor on the right and a neighbor on the left, with an area of 750 m², and the exterior cladding is stone.
2- The house consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, roof, and a courtyard with an annex, detailed as follows:
(a) The basement is an open space.
(b) The ground floor consists of 5 rooms + 3 bathrooms + a kitchen).
(c) The first floor consists of 5 rooms + 3 bathrooms + a kitchen).
(d) The roof consists of a laundry room.
(e) The annex consists of 3 rooms + a storage room + a kitchen + a bathroom).
3- The house's air conditioning consists of separate units, and there is no elevator in the house.

## Secondly: Auction Terms <orig>شروط المزاد</orig>:

Firstly: The auction <orig>المزاد</orig> shall commence at the base price specified for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the amount immediately upon the session being held based on that price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one else bids for the property, the auction shall immediately be re-held at their expense, based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by a full deposit of its value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's value.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the expenses of enforcement procedures <orig>إجراءات التنفيذ</orig> amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement shall be published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall be responsible for it, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance (i.e., a thorough inspection).
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment <orig>حكم رسو المزاد</orig> is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the expropriated owner <orig>من نزعت ملكيته</orig> was residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent <orig>أجرة المثل</orig>."
Important Note:
All companies and individual establishments are prohibited from participating in auctions for plots or houses designated for private residential purposes, in accordance with the provisions of Article 230 of the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig>, added by Law No. 9 of 2008.

President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

Secondly: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall commence at the base price. To participate in the auction, at least one-fifth of that price must be paid by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Execution Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.

Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.

Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.

Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one else comes forward to bid, the auction shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, legal fees, administrative expenses, and the cost of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.

Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office of the General Court <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.

Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

Notice:
- 1- This announcement of sale shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
- 2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.

In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by a full deposit of its value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any reduction in the property's price.

President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

# Preamble

The founders acknowledge their legal capacity to establish a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company among themselves and their commitment to the rules stipulated for its establishment in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations. They also acknowledge their commitment to all articles stipulated for the establishment of the company in accordance with the provisions of the following articles:

### Company Name and Commercial Address:
Tanara Holding Company <orig>شركة تنارا القابضة</orig> and its commercial address is the State of Kuwait – a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company (K.C.S.C.) Holding.
The company's main center is located in the State of Kuwait, and its domicile is the "State of Kuwait". Shareholders may transfer the main center to any other location within the State of Kuwait, and open branches and agencies for the company inside and outside the State of Kuwait. The company's headquarters is considered its legal domicile, which is relied upon for directing correspondence and judicial notices to it, and its data is recorded in the Commercial Register. Any change to this headquarters is not effective until it is registered in the Commercial Register.
The founders acknowledge that the company was established in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. (1) of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم (1) لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, its executive regulations, and the provisions of this contract. The company acquires legal personality from the date of registration, and may not engage in its activities except from the date of registration and the approval of all regulatory authorities for its engagement in the activity.

<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1721 Seventy-First Year
Sunday, 12 Rajab 1446 AH - 12/1/2025 AD
</header>
117

The company's duration is indefinite, commencing from the date of registration.
Without prejudice to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
1- Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities.
2- Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for conducting its activities within the limits permitted by law.
3- Financing and lending to companies in which it holds shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than 20%.
The company may conduct these activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either directly or through agency.
It may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated purposes.
The company's fiscal year begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year.
An exception is made for the first fiscal year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ends on December 31st of the following fiscal year.
The company's authorized capital is set at KWD 7,000,000 (seven million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only).
The issued capital is KWD 7,000,000 (seven million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only).
The paid-up capital is KWD 1,750,000 (one million seven hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
The company's issued capital consists of cash shares distributed as follows:
KWD 1,750,000 (one million seven hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) in cash, paid by Burgan Bank <orig>بنك برقان</orig> as per the certificate issued by the bank on 11/12/2024.
The founders signatory to this contract have subscribed to the entire capital of the company as follows:

The founders acknowledge that they have deposited 25% of the company's cash capital, amounting to KWD 1,750,000 (one million seven hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only), representing their respective subscription percentages, with Burgan Bank <orig>بنك برقان</orig>, as per the certificate issued by the aforementioned bank dated 11/12/2024 and attached to the original of this contract.
The expenses, outlays, wages, and costs incurred by the company due to its establishment are approximately KWD 10,000 (ten thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) and shall be deducted from the general expenses account.
The founders signatory to this contract undertake to carry out all necessary procedures for the completion of the company's establishment and commit to excluding and canceling fictitious and duplicate subscription requests and taking the necessary measures to achieve this.
For this purpose, they have appointed Mr. Haroun Abdul Hussein Haji Behbehani <orig>هارون عبد الحسين حاجي بهمن</orig> to take legal actions, complete the necessary documents, and introduce any amendments deemed necessary by official authorities <orig>الجهات الرسمية</orig> in the contract or its attached Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>.
Within three months from the date of completion of the subscription and before the constituent assembly meeting, the founders must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of shares subscribed by each founder, their payment of due installments, their names, addresses, the share value, and the amount paid thereof.
The company's founders are jointly and severally liable for compensating any damage incurred by the company, its shareholders, or third parties due to the invalidity of the company's contract.

### Article (1)
In accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations, and these Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة</orig> named: Afnan Holding Company (Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company) <orig>شركة أفنان القابضة (شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة) قابضة</orig> has been established between the owners of the shares whose provisions are set forth hereinafter.

### Article (2)
The company's head office and legal domicile are in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, in Al-Rai <orig>الري</orig> area. This is the domicile to be relied upon for directing correspondence and judicial notices. Any change to this domicile shall not be recognized unless the change is registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may establish branches, agencies, or offices in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or abroad.

### Article (3)
The duration of this company is indefinite and commences from the date of registration.

### Article (4)
Without prejudice to the provisions of Law Decree No. 1 of 2016 <orig>المرسوم بقانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> concerning Companies, its amendments, and its executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
1- Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities.
2- Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for conducting its business within the limits permitted by law.
3- Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's share in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than 20%.
The company shall have the right to conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either directly or through agency.
It may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated purposes.

### Article (5)
The company's authorized capital is set at KWD 7,000,000 (seven million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only).
The issued capital is KWD 7,000,000 (seven million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only).
And the paid-up capital is KWD 1,750,000 (one million seven hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
The company's issued capital consists of cash shares distributed as follows:
KWD 1,750,000 (one million seven hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) in cash, paid by Burgan Bank <orig>بنك برقان</orig> according to the certificate issued by the bank on 11/12/2024.

### Article (6)
The company's shares are nominal and may not be owned by non-Kuwaitis <orig>غير الكويتيين</orig> in accordance with the provisions of the law and relevant ministerial decisions.

### Article (7)
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> may authorize the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to determine the date of its implementation. However, by a decision of the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة الشركة</orig>, the issued capital may be increased within the limits of the authorized capital, provided that the issued capital has been fully paid.
New shares may not be issued for less than their nominal value.

### Article (8)
If the value of the original shares has been fully paid, the company's authorized capital may be increased by a decision issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> after obtaining the approval of the regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, based on a reasoned proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and a report from the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> in this regard, provided that the decision to increase the capital specifies the amount and methods of the increase.

### Article (9)
If an increase in the company's capital is decided, and some shareholders do not exercise their priority right to subscribe to the capital increase shares, the unsubscribed shares shall be allocated to those shareholders of the company who wish to subscribe. If the subscription requests exceed the number of shares offered, they shall be allocated to the subscribers proportionally to their subscribed amount.
In all cases where the entire new shares are not subscribed, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may allocate the unsubscribed shares to new shareholders. The unsubscribed new shares shall be deemed cancelled by operation of law – the company's capital is set at KWD 7,000,000 (seven million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only).

### Article (10)
The company may increase its capital through public subscription, as stipulated in Article (160) of Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> concerning Companies, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

The shareholder's right to dispose of their shares is restricted by the following two limitations: 1.

2. Requiring the approval of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for share purchasers.
Article (12)
Before disposing of his shares, a shareholder must notify the company of the terms of sale. The disposal of shares shall not be effective until ten days have elapsed from the date of notification without any of the shareholders submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder comes forward to purchase the shares, this must be done at the price stated in the terms of sale.
Article (13)
Without prejudice to the provisions regarding the company's purchase of its own shares, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, in the event of its rejection of the buyer's person, must purchase the shares on behalf of the company within ten days from the date the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> is notified of the request for approval. In this case, the purchase shall be at the price at which the shareholder agreed to sell his shares.
Article (14)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> who signed the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> subscribed to the entire capital of the company with shares totaling (70,000,000) (seventy million shares) with a nominal value of (7,000,000 K.D.) (seven million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), distributed among them, each according to their subscription ratio specified in the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>. An amount of 1,750,000 K.D. (only one million seven hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) of the nominal value of the shares they subscribed to has been paid to Burgan Bank <orig>بنك برقان</orig> according to the certificate issued by the said bank, dated 11/12/2024, and attached to the original of this contract.
The remaining part of the share value shall be paid within a maximum period of five years from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>, and on the dates specified by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. If a shareholder delays in paying the installment due on his shares on time, the company must, after fifteen days from the date of his warning, offer his shares for sale to the remaining shareholders. The company shall recover from the sale price of the shares, with priority over all creditors of the shareholder, the value of the unpaid installments, interest, and any expenses incurred by the company. The remainder shall be returned to the shareholder. If the sale price of the shares is insufficient, the company shall claim the remainder from the shareholder's private assets.
Article (15)
Ownership of a share necessarily entails the shareholder's acceptance of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, the provisions of the company's Articles of Incorporation <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, and the resolutions of its General Assembly <orig>جمعيتها العامة</orig>.
Article (16)
Every share grants its owner the right to an equal share to that of others, without discrimination, in the ownership of the company's assets and in the distributed profits.
Article (17)
The company shall have a special register kept with a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>, in which the names of shareholders, their nationalities, domiciles, the number of shares owned by each of them, their type, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded. Any changes occurring to the registered data shall be endorsed in the shareholders' register according to the information received by the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig> to provide them with data from this register.
Article (18)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must, within three months from the date of the completion of the subscription and before the meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of subscribed shares, the payment of due installments by subscribers, the names and addresses of subscribers, the number of shares subscribed by each of them, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.
Article (19)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must call for the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene within three months from the date of the completion of the subscription. If this period elapses without the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> being held, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> shall, within fifteen days from the date of the expiry of the said period, call for the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene.
Article (20)
The invitation to attend the meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall include the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, and shall be sent by one of the following methods:
1. Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2. Announcement, which must be made twice, with the second announcement taking place after a period of no less than seven days from the date of publication of the first announcement and at least seven days before the meeting.
3. Hand delivery of the invitation to shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
4. Any other modern means of communication specified in the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda, date, and place of the meeting at least seven days before its convening, for its representative to attend.
The meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be chaired by the person elected by the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> for this purpose.
Article (21)
The meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders with voting rights representing more than half of the subscribed shares.
If this quorum is not met, the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> must be called to a second meeting with the same agenda, to be held within a period of no less than seven days and no more than

A new invitation for the second meeting may not be issued if its date was specified in the invitation for the first meeting. Resolutions shall be passed by an absolute majority of the shares present at the meeting.

## Article (22)
The founders shall submit to the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> a report containing comprehensive information about all incorporation procedures and the amounts expended, along with supporting documents. This report shall be made available at a place designated by the founders for subscribers to review, at least seven days before the Assembly meeting. This shall be indicated in the invitation to subscribers to attend the meeting.

## Article (23)
The Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be competent to address the following matters:
1. Approving the company's incorporation procedures after verifying their validity and conformity with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and the company's articles of association.
2. Approving the valuation of in-kind shares, if any, as stipulated in Article (11) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
3. Electing the members of the first Board of Directors.
4. Appointing the auditor and determining their fees.
5. Appointing members of the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> if the company conducts its activities in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>.
6. Declaring the final incorporation of the company.
A copy of the minutes of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting, including the resolutions adopted, shall be sent to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The first Board of Directors shall publish the company's articles of association and register it in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> within thirty days from the date of the final declaration of the company's incorporation.

## Article (24)
A member of the company shall specifically enjoy the following rights:
1. Receiving profits and obtaining bonus shares decided for distribution.
2. Participating in the company's management through membership in the Board of Directors and attending General Assemblies <orig>الجمعيات العامة</orig> and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and these Articles of Association. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.
3. Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting, the company's financial statements for the expired accounting period, the Board of Directors' report, and the auditor's report.
4. Disposing of shares owned by them and priority in subscribing to new shares.
5. Obtaining a share of the company's assets upon liquidation after settling its debts.

## Article (25)
A member of the company shall specifically be obligated to the following:
1. Paying installments due on shares owned by them upon their due dates and paying compensation for delay in payment.
2. Paying expenses incurred by the company for the collection of paid installments from the value of their shares. The company may execute on the shares to satisfy its rights.
3. Implementing resolutions issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
4. Refraining from any act that harms the financial or moral interests of the company and committing to compensate for damages arising from violating this.

## Article (26)
The General Assembly of Shareholders <orig>الجمعية العامة للمساهمين</orig> may not do the following:
1. Increasing the shareholder's financial burdens or increasing the nominal value of the share.
2. Decreasing the percentage of net profits to be distributed to shareholders as specified in the company's articles of association.
3. Imposing new conditions, other than those mentioned in the articles of incorporation or these Articles of Association, related to the shareholder's right to attend and vote in General Assemblies <orig>الجمعيات العامة</orig>.
These provisions may be deviated from with the written consent of all shareholders or by a unanimous vote involving all shareholders, and by completing the necessary procedures to amend the company's articles of association.

## Article (27)
A- The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall manage the company, consisting of (5 members) five members. The term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease and a new Board of Directors is elected.

## Article (28)
Shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> by secret ballot. The company's articles of association may stipulate that no more than half of the members of the first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be elected from among the company's founders.

## Article (29)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall elect by secret ballot a Chairman of the Board <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and a Vice Chairman <orig>نائباً للرئيس</orig>. The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to other competencies specified in the articles of association. The signature of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is considered valid in the company's relationship with third parties. The Chairman must implement the Board's resolutions and adhere to its recommendations. The Vice Chairman shall act in place of the Chairman in their absence or if there is an impediment preventing them from exercising their powers.

The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall invite the General Assembly of Shareholders <orig>الجمعية العامة للمساهمين</orig> to convene within two months from the date of the last vacant position, and elect those who fill the vacant positions.
### Article (36)
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>:
1. Must possess legal capacity to act.
2. Must not have been previously convicted of a felony with a freedom-restricting penalty, or a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud, or a crime against honor or trust, or a freedom-restricting penalty for violating the provisions of this Law, unless his reputation has been restored.
3. Must personally own, or the person he represents must own, a number of the company's shares.
If a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> loses any of the aforementioned conditions, his membership shall cease.
### Article (37)
Membership in the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall not be included in the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article 234 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
A person may be the chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> of more than one closed joint-stock company.
### Article (38)
The chairman or a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of his position to gain benefit for himself or for others.
A member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may dispose of his shares in the company during his membership in the Board, without prejudice to the restrictions on the disposal of shares stipulated in the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, the company's articles of association, or these regulations.
### Article (39)
Members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meetings, or to third parties, any company secrets they became aware of due to their management of the company. Otherwise, they shall be dismissed and held accountable for compensating damages resulting from the violation.
### Article (40)
The chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or any of its members may not combine membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> of two competing companies, or participate in any work that would compete with the company, or trade for his own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity carried out by the company. Otherwise, the company shall have the right to demand compensation from him or to consider the operations he carried out for his own account as if they were carried out for the company's account.
Unless this is done with the approval of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.
### Article (41)
The total remuneration of the chairman and members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not exceed ten percent of the net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves.
### Article (30)
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer <orig>رئيساً تنفيذياً</orig> appointed by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> from among its members or from others, who shall be entrusted with the management of the company. The Board shall determine his allowances and powers to sign on behalf of the company.
### Article (31)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may distribute work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board may also delegate one of its members, a committee from among its members, or a third party to perform one or more specific tasks, supervise an aspect of the company's activity, or exercise some of the powers or competencies entrusted to the Board.
### Article (32)
Any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in proportion to the shares they own in it. The number of Board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining Board members, except to the extent exceeding the proportion used in appointing their representatives to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives for them on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and duties as elected members, and the shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of his representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.
### Article (33)
A meeting of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by half the number of members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than five. Meetings may be held using modern communication methods. Decisions may be taken by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must meet at least six times during the year.
### Article (34)
Minutes of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> meetings shall be recorded and signed by the attending members and the Board secretary. Any member who did not approve the decision taken may record his objection in the meeting minutes.
### Article (35)
If a position of a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> member becomes vacant, it shall be filled by the shareholder who received the highest number of votes among those who did not win Board membership. If there is an impediment to him, the next in line shall fill the position. The new member shall complete only the term of his predecessor.
However, if the vacant positions reach one-quarter of the original positions, then it is incumbent upon [the Board] to distribute a profit of not less than 5% of the capital to the shareholders (a higher percentage may be agreed upon).
<page_end>145</page_end>

An annual bonus not exceeding six thousand dinars may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and to each member of this Board <orig>أعضاء هذا المجلس</orig> from the date of the company's establishment until the achievement of profits that allow for the distribution of bonuses in accordance with the preceding paragraph. By a resolution issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة للشركة</orig>, an independent board member may be exempted from the minimum aforementioned bonuses (if the company has independent members). The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is obligated to submit an annual report to the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة للشركة</orig> for approval, provided that it accurately includes a detailed statement of the amounts, benefits, and advantages received by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, regardless of their nature or designation.

Article (42)
No person who has a representative on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or the chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig>, or any member of the Board of Directors <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or any member of the executive management <orig>الإدارة التنفيذية</orig>, or their spouses, or their second-degree relatives, may have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and transactions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

Article (43)
The company may not lend to any of its Board members <orig>أعضاء مجلس إدارتها</orig>, or the Chief Executive Officer <orig>الرئيس التنفيذي</orig>, or their spouses, or their second-degree relatives, or their affiliated companies, unless there is authorization from the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة للشركة</orig>. Any action taken in violation thereof shall not be enforceable against the company, without prejudice to the rights of good faith third parties.

Article (44)
The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and its members are responsible towards the company, shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud and abuse of authority, for every violation of the law or the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>, and for errors in management. Without filing a liability lawsuit <orig>دعوى المسؤولية</orig>, a proposal from the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to discharge the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> from liability is not permissible. Board members <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not participate in voting on General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> resolutions related to their discharge from liability for their management, or those concerning a special benefit for them, their spouses, or their first-degree relatives, or a conflict existing between them and the company.

Article (45)
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be either personal liability <orig>مسؤولية شخصية</orig> pertaining to a specific member, or joint liability <orig>مسؤولية مشتركة</orig> among all members of the Board of Directors <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig>. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable <orig>مسئولين جميعاً على وجه التضامن</orig> to pay compensation, except for those who objected to the decision that established the liability and recorded their objection in the minutes.

Article (46)
The company may file a liability lawsuit <orig>دعوى المسؤولية</orig> against the members of the Board of Directors <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig> due to errors that cause damage to the company. If the company is in liquidation <orig>دور التصفية</orig>, the liquidator <orig>المصفي</orig> shall undertake filing the lawsuit.

Article (47)
Every shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig> may individually file a liability lawsuit <orig>دعوى المسؤولية</orig> on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be joined as a party <orig>اختصام الشركة</orig> for compensation to be awarded to it if warranted. The shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> may file their personal lawsuit for compensation if the error has caused them damage. Any agreement to the contrary is null and void.

B- The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>

Article (48)
The Annual Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية السنوية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within the three months following the end of the financial year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. The Board <orig>المجلس</orig> may invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to meet whenever necessary. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must issue an invitation to the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> based on a reasoned request from a number of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> owning ten percent of the company's capital, or upon a request from the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, within fifteen days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be prepared by the inviting party. The provisions related to the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments shall apply to the procedures for inviting the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> and the quorum for attendance and voting.

Article (49)
Every shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig>, regardless of the number of their shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> may not vote on their own behalf or on behalf of whom they represent in matters related to a special benefit for them, or a conflict existing between them and the company. Any condition or resolution that violates this is null and void. A shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> may delegate another person to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney <orig>توكيل خاص</orig> or an authorization prepared by the company for this purpose. Anyone claiming a right over shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholders' register <orig>سجل مساهمي الشركة</orig> may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to obtain an order on petition to deprive the disputed shares <orig>الأسهم المتنازع عليها</orig> of voting for a period specified by the judge or until the dispute is settled by the competent court <orig>المحكمة المختصة</orig>, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.

Article (50)
The meeting of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> or their deputy, or by someone delegated by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for that purpose, or by someone elected by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> from among the shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> or others.
<page_end>146</page_end>

## Article (51)
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> in its annual meeting is competent to take decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular, the following:
1. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended financial year.
2. The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
3. A report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4. The company's financial statements.
5. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
6. Discharge of the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members.
7. Election or dismissal of Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members, and determination of their remunerations.
8. Appointment of the company's auditor, and determination of their fees or authorization of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in this regard.
9. Reporting on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties <orig>الأطراف ذات الصلة</orig>, where related parties are defined according to International Accounting Standards.

## Article (52)
By a resolution issued by the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, the chairman or one or more members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may be dismissed, or the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may be dissolved and a new board elected, based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> owning no less than a quarter of the issued capital <orig>رأسمال المصدر</orig>.
Upon the issuance of a resolution to dissolve the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and the election of a new board at the same meeting, the group may decide either that this board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the new board is elected, or to appoint a temporary administrative committee <orig>لجنة إدارية مؤقتة</orig> whose primary task shall be to convene the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to elect the new board, within one month of its appointment.

## Article (53)
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> may not discuss topics not included in the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or became apparent during the meeting, or if requested by a regulatory authority <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, the auditor, or a number of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> owning five percent of the company's capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة</orig>. If, during the discussion, it becomes apparent that the information related to some presented matters is insufficient, the meeting must be adjourned for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> owning a quarter of the issued share capital <orig>أسهم رأس المال المصدر</orig>. The adjourned meeting shall be held without the need for new invitation procedures.

## Article (54)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> unless those resolutions violate the law, the articles of incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, or these bylaws <orig>هذا النظام</orig>.

The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must re-present the violating resolutions to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> in a meeting convened to discuss the aspects of the violation.

## Article (55)
The provisions related to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall apply to the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig>, taking into account the provisions stipulated in the following articles:

## Article (56)
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or upon a reasoned request from shareholders <orig>مساهمين</orig> representing fifteen percent of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig> or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must invite the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> to a meeting within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
If the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> fails to invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall issue the invitation for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

## Article (57)
The meeting of the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders <orig>مساهمون</orig> representing three-quarters of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>. If this quorum is not met, an invitation shall be issued for a second meeting, which shall be valid if attended by those representing more than half of the issued capital <orig>رأس المال المصدر</orig>.
Resolutions shall be issued by a majority exceeding half of the total shares of the company's issued capital <orig>أسهم رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>.

## Article (58)
Subject to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> is competent in the following matters:
1. Amendment of the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2. Sale of the entire project for which the company was established, or disposal of it in any other manner.
3. Dissolution of the company, or its merger, transformation, or division.
4. Increase or decrease of the company's capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة</orig>.

## Article (59)
Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be effective until the publication procedures <orig>إجراءات الشهر</orig> have been taken.
The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, objectives, or capital <orig>رأسمالها</orig>.

## Article (60)
Any shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig> may file a lawsuit for the nullification of any resolution issued by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية أو غير العادية</orig> that violates the law, the company's articles of incorporation <orig>عقد تأسيس الشركة</orig>, or these bylaws <orig>هذا النظام</orig>, or that is intended to harm the company's interests, and may claim compensation if necessary.
Furthermore, resolutions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assemblies <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية وغير العادية</orig> that prejudice the rights of the minority may be challenged. The challenge shall be made by a number of the company's shareholders <orig>مساهمي الشركة</orig> owning fifteen percent of the issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>, provided they did not approve those resolutions.
<page_end>147</page_end>

## Article (61)
The company shall be liable – jointly and severally – for the debts of its subsidiary partners if the following conditions are met:
1. Insufficiency of the subsidiary company's funds to meet its obligations.
2. The company owns a percentage of the subsidiary company's capital that enables it to control the appointment of the majority of the members of the board of directors or managers, or the decisions issued by the management.
3. The subsidiary company takes decisions or performs actions that target the interest of the owning and controlling company and harm the interest of the subsidiary company or its creditors, and these actions are the main reason for the subsidiary company's inability to meet its obligations.
All of the above applies unless the holding company is liable for the subsidiary company's debts based on another reason.

## Article (62)
The company's financial year begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year, with the exception of the first financial year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ends on December 31st of the following financial year.

## Article (63)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve for the company.
The Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
The statutory reserve may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of profits to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of an optional reserve that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits. What has been deducted from the statutory reserve must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.
Also, one percent (1%) shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> from the company's net profit.

## Article (64)
Annually, a percentage shall be deducted from the gross profits, determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> after consulting the auditor, for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for the decrease in their value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

## Article (65)
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the company's obligations under labor laws and social insurance laws. A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.

## Article (66)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve allocated for the purposes determined by the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig>.

## Article (67)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, may distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the financial year. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and this distribution must not affect the company's paid-up capital.

## Article (68)
### Auditor
The provisions of the articles contained in Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its amendments, specifically Articles No. 227 to 233, shall apply.

## Article (69)
At the end of each financial year, the company must prepare a consolidated balance sheet and profit and loss statements for itself and all its subsidiary partners, accompanied by explanations and data in accordance with international accounting standards.

## Article (70)
### Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company
The company shall be dissolved by one of the matters stipulated in Articles No. 266 to 277 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

## Article (71)
The liquidation of the company shall be carried out as specified in the provisions of Articles No. 278 to 295 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

## Article (72)
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the articles of incorporation or in these bylaws.

## Article (73)
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's head office and on its website. An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file with the competent department at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. Any person wishing to obtain a true copy may request it from the company for a specific fee determined by the company.

## Announcement
### Zakat and Public Contribution Assessment for On Time General Maintenance Company <orig>شركة أون تايم للصيانة العامة</orig> for the Financial Year Ending 31/12/2016 –
### Registration No.: 190950

After reviewing your financial declaration, financial statements, and attached documents for the aforementioned financial year, and pursuant to the provisions of Law No. (46) of 2006 regarding Zakat <orig>الزكاة</orig> and the contribution of Kuwaiti public and closed shareholding companies to the state budget, and its Executive Regulations No. (58) of 2007, and the executive rules and instructions issued by Administrative Decision No. (876) of 2013 for assessment and collection procedures, and after examining your data and accounting documents, the Ministry has decided the following:
Given that the company incurred a financial loss during the financial year subject to assessment, and with no impact from disallowed provisions or deductions permitted by law on these losses, we inform you of the Ministry's acceptance of the financial declaration's loss without deducting provisions.
Accordingly, the examination result indicates the existence of losses for the financial year ending 31/12/2016, which precludes any amount being due from the company. In accordance with Article No. (5) of the Executive Regulations, losses shall be limited to this financial year and shall not be carried forward to subsequent years, while preserving the Ministry's right to re-issue the assessment and correct the final assessment in accordance with the provisions of Articles No. (13) and (14) of the Executive Regulations and what is consistent with the conditions.
Undersecretary of the Ministry of Finance <orig>وكيل وزارة المالية</orig>

### Zakat and Public Contribution Assessment for Al-Shafaq Environmental Industries Company <orig>شركة الشفق للصناعات البيئية</orig> for the Financial Year Ending 31/12/2018
### Registration No.: 195480 -

After reviewing your financial declaration, financial statements, and attached documents for the aforementioned financial year, and pursuant to the provisions of Law No. (46) of 2006 regarding Zakat <orig>الزكاة</orig> and the contribution of Kuwaiti public and closed shareholding companies to the state budget, and its Executive Regulations No. (58) of 2007, and the executive rules and instructions issued by Administrative Decision No. (876) of 2013 for assessment and collection procedures, and after examining your data and accounting documents, the Ministry has decided the following:
The Ministry has decided to accept the results of your operations as per your financial declaration without modification. Accordingly, no amounts are due from the company for the aforementioned year, while preserving the Ministry's right to re-issue the assessment and correct the financial assessment.

Paaet.edu.kw) for purchasing the tender document listed under electronic services (general services) and submitting bids at the Authority's new headquarters located in Al-Shuwaikh Industrial Area <orig>منطقة الشويخ الصناعية</orig>, 7th Floor - Supplies Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات</orig> within one week for a non-refundable fee of (-/75 K.D.).

Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig>

Announcement
The Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> announces the publication of the announcement for tender No. H.A./Sh.A.M./65-2025/2024 related to the operation, maintenance, and repair of swimming pools (Al-Adiliya <orig>العديلية</orig>) according to the terms and specifications stated in the tender documents.
Companies and institutions interested in this tender must visit the website of the Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> (www.Paaet.edu.kw) to purchase the tender document listed under electronic services (general services) for a non-refundable fee of (-/75 K.D.). Bids must be submitted to the Authority's General Office <orig>ديوان عام الهيئة</orig> located in Al-Shuwaikh Educational Area <orig>منطقة الشويخ التعليمية</orig> - Supplies Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات</orig> within (two weeks) from this date.

Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig>

Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig>
Announcement
The Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> announces that the individuals whose names are listed below have had their residential addresses removed from its records (based on the declaration of the property owner or due to the demolition of the building). These individuals must visit the Authority to register a new address (after providing supporting documents) within thirty days from this date, otherwise they will be subject to the penalty stipulated in Article (33) of Law No. 32 of 1982, a fine not exceeding one hundred Dinars <orig>دينار</orig>, multiplied by the number of individuals.

Companies and establishments wishing to participate in this practice may obtain the practice document by submitting a letter expressing their desire to purchase the practice, provided that it is signed by the authorized signatory of the company or establishment, along with the designation of the authorized purchaser.

Please note that a preliminary meeting for bidders has been scheduled at the headquarters of the Kuwait Anti-Doping Agency <orig>الوكالة الكويتية لمكافحة المنشطات</orig>, located in Salmiya <orig>السالمية</orig> area – Block 2 – Gulf Street – Olympia Complex <orig>مجمع اولمبيا</orig> – East Tower – 8th Floor, at 12:30 PM on Sunday, 19/01/2025.

Bids must be submitted between 9:00 AM and 1:00 PM. Bids must be delivered in sealed envelopes with red wax and placed in the box designated for practices at the headquarters of the Kuwait Anti-Doping Agency <orig>الوكالة الكويتية لمكافحة المنشطات</orig>, located in Salmiya <orig>السالمية</orig> area – Block 2 – Gulf Street – Olympia Complex <orig>مجمع اولمبيا</orig> – East Tower – 8th Floor. The practitioner also undertakes that the bid shall be valid for a period of (90) ninety days from the date of the closing deadline. Any bid not accompanied by the original or a copy of the receipt for purchasing the practice documents, the original preliminary guarantee, and a valid national labor support certificate issued by the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية والعمل</orig> shall be excluded.
The practice is open to companies and specialized establishments registered with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> for the required works, provided that their registration certificate is valid.
All bidding companies must have their representative attend the bid opening meeting at the headquarters of the Kuwait Anti-Doping Agency <orig>الوكالة الكويتية لمكافحة المنشطات</orig> located in Salmiya <orig>السالمية</orig> area – Block 2 – Gulf Street – Olympia Complex – East Tower – 8th Floor, on Thursday, 23/01/2025, at 2:30 PM.
Note: The Kuwait Anti-Doping Agency <orig>الوكالة الكويتية لمكافحة المنشطات</orig> may cancel the practice without stating reasons and without objection from the practitioners.

## Management and Right of Signature
### Article (6)
The company shall be managed by the capital owner, personally if a natural person, and by his representative if a legal entity.

One or more managers may be appointed to represent it before the judiciary and against third parties, and shall be responsible for its management before the owner. The decision to appoint a manager shall not be effective until it is registered in the Commercial Register.

### Article (7)
The manager represents the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, and has the broadest authority to deal on its behalf and conclude all contracts and transactions falling within the company's objectives, specifically appointing, suspending, and dismissing the company's agents and employees, determining their salaries, wages, and bonuses, receiving and paying amounts, signing, transferring, and concluding all contracts, agreements, and deals related to the company's transactions and achieving its objectives, whether in cash or on credit, and with anyone he wishes, in all or some of the management powers. (Unless the manager is appointed and his powers are defined in the company's articles of association or in the decision issued by the capital owner appointing him). He has the right to open bank accounts, and the company manager shall exercise the diligence of a prudent person in exercising his powers and authorities.

### Article (8)
The capital owner shall have jurisdiction over the following matters:
1. Amending the company's articles of association.
2. Dissolving and liquidating the company.
3. Merging, converting, or splitting the company.
4. Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.
5. Dismissing the company manager, or restricting his authority.
Subject to the provisions of merger, conversion, and split stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017, and its executive regulations, the preceding decisions shall be implemented by registering them in the Commercial Register without the need for formal documentation.

## Company Accounts
### Article (9)
The company's financial year begins in January and ends in December of each year, with the exception of the first financial year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register and ends on the specified date for the end of the following financial year.

## Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company
### Article (10)
The company shall also be dissolved – and insofar as it does not conflict with the nature of a single-person company – for one of the reasons stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017, and its executive regulations.

# Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>
## Announcement
### Practice No. (31-2024 / 2025)
Provision of Information Systems Network Specialist at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>

The Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. (31-2024/2025) concerning the provision of an Information Systems Network Specialist at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>, in accordance with the terms and specifications mentioned in the practice documents, with adherence to scheduling appointments for government entities as per the esteemed Council of Ministers' decisions. Documents can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department – Tenders and Contracts Section at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> starting from Sunday, 12/01/2025, during official working hours, upon payment of an amount of (75 K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, provided that payment is made via K-Net.
A preliminary meeting will be held at the headquarters of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> on Monday, 20/01/2025, at 11:00 AM.
The documents shall be returned after completion, accompanied by the required supporting documents and a preliminary bid bond of no less than (2%) of the bid value, in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this bid bond will be disregarded, even if they conform to specifications. The bid bond must be valid for the required bid validity period. The documents shall be submitted in an official envelope sealed with red wax, and bids will be delivered to the (Tenders and Contracts Section) at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>.
Please note that the deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Sunday, 02/02/2025. Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

The dissolution of the company must be publicized, and the dissolution of the company cannot be invoked against third parties except from the date of publication. The company's manager must follow up on the implementation of this procedure.

### Article (11)
Upon its dissolution for any reason, the company's assets shall be liquidated in accordance with the provisions stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017, and its executive regulations.

### Article (12)
The owner shall be personally liable for the company's obligations in the following cases:
a) If they, in bad faith, liquidate it or cease its activity before the expiration of its term, or before achieving the purpose for which it was established.
b) If they fail to separate their financial liability from the company's financial liability.
c) If they conduct business on behalf of the company before it acquires legal personality.

### Article (13)
All papers, contracts, publications, advertisements, correspondence, and other documents issued by the company must bear its trade name, a statement of its legal form, its registration number in the commercial register, a statement of the amount of its capital and the paid-up portion thereof, followed by the phrase "Single Person Company (S.P.C.) <orig>شركة الشخص الواحد (ش.ش.و)</orig>".

### Article (14)
The company – regarding matters not mentioned in these Articles of Association – shall be subject to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017, and its executive regulations.

### Article (15)
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's main office and on its website.
An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file with both the competent department at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, and the Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الإستثمار المباشر</orig>.
An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file with the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Any person wishing to obtain a true copy must request it from the company against a fee determined by the company's management.
First Party: Microsoft Corporation <orig>شركة مايكروسوفت كوربوريشن</orig>

The Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig> announces the submission by:

| | |
|:---|:---|
| **PKA Design and Decoration Works LLC <orig>شركة بي كي أي لأعمال تصميم وتنفيذ الديكور ذ.م.م</orig> (United Arab Emirates)** | Activity: Design and decoration works. |
| No Logo | |
| **Polymarkets International for General Trading and Contracting LLC <orig>شركة بوليماركتس العالمية للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م</orig> (Kuwait)** | Activity: Building construction and wholesale and retail physical trade. |
<image_caption>Polymarkets International for General Trading and Contracting LLC Logo</image_caption>

of a request for approval to complete an economic concentration process.

Acquisition by PKA Design and Decoration Works LLC <orig>شركة بي كي أي لأعمال تصميم وتنفيذ الديكور ذ.م.م</orig> (United Arab Emirates) of 51% of the shares in Polymarkets International for General Trading and Contracting LLC <orig>شركة بوليماركتس العالمية للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م</orig> (Kuwait).

In accordance with Law No. (72) of 2020 regarding Competition Protection <orig>حماية المنافسة</orig> and Article (83) of its Executive Regulations issued by Resolution No. (14) of 2021 and its amendments, which stipulate that "any interested party may submit a reasoned objection to the Agency regarding the economic concentration request within a period not exceeding (15) fifteen days from the date of notification or publication..."

Accordingly, the Agency invites any interested party to submit their reasoned objection to the aforementioned economic concentration process within a period not exceeding fifteen days from the date of this announcement.

Objection data should be submitted at the headquarters of the Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>, Al Hamra Tower <orig>برج الحمراء</orig>, 14th Floor, by filling out the form available on the website, along with paying the prescribed fee.
